discussion.content:
Answer 1 should be N: 

"
In this scenario where the site has default sharing link type settings, and a document in that site has different default link type settings, the more restrictive scope settings will be applied at the time the user selects the sharing option for the document. For example:

The default sharing link type for the site is scoped to anybody in your organization. A document in that site is labeled with the default sharing link type set to specific people. When a user shares that document, the default sharing link type selected will be scoped to specific people.

The default sharing link type for the site is scoped to specific people, with edit permissions. A document in that site is labeled with the default sharing link type set to anybody in the organization, with view permissions. When a user shares that document, the default sharing link type selected will be scoped to specific people with edit permissions."

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/sensitivity-labels-default-sharing-link

Correct, once the label is applied the external sharing settings of the label overrides the previous settings of the site. 
1. Y
2. N, since "Anyone" is selected invitations are not needed. It's only needed if "guest" option is selected for sharing.
3. N
Internal user can share the files with people inside of the organization.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains a Microsoft SharePoint Online site named Site1 and a sensitivity label named Label1.

The external sharing settings for Site1 are configured as shown in the Site1 exhibit. (Click the Site1 tab.)

//IMG//


The external sharing settings for Label1 are configured as shown in the Label1 exhibit. (Click the Label1 tab.)

//IMG//


Label1 is applied to Site1.

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: I feel the correct answer should be File 1 & 2, for both the options. There is no mention that retention policy is configured to mark the file as record, so technically user can delete the file and automatically a copy will be kept in preservation hold.

comments.content: This is correct, these questions can be so unclear..

discussion.content:
As per this link:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/records-management#compare-restrictions-for-what-actions-are-allowed-or-blocked

File1 and File2 can be deleted by both users with Retention Label

Retention1 surely has the "Retain items for a specific period" because is the only one that allow you to select the "Deactivate retention settings".
Retention2 could can has both "Retain items..." or "Enforce actions..." (labeled items won't be retained) options applied but I assume that has the "Enforce actions" because if we need to retain the item simply we should configure Retention1 for 3 years.

May 15, 2023: File2 only
Aug 15, 2024: File1 only
idk. it's not a record so it could delete them, and you'll find them in the Preservation Hold library... which is the true way?

Selected Answer: A
Correct, when you run Get-UnifiedGroup -Identity "Team1", it will provide details including the group's email address (which corresponds to the team's mailbox) and the SharePoint site URL associated with the team.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.

You have a team named Team1 in Microsoft Teams.

You plan to place all the content in Team1 on hold.

You need to identify which mailbox and which Microsoft SharePoint site collection are associated to Team1.

Which cmdlet should you use?

discussion.content: I was able to perform this, appears correct.

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-

Use the following login credentials as needed:

To enter your username, place your cursor in the Sign in box and click on the username below.

To enter your password, place your cursor in the Enter password box and click on the password below.

Microsoft 365 Username: admin@123456789.onmicrosoft.com
Microsoft 365 Password: **********

If the Microsoft 365 portal does not load successfully in the browser, press CTRL-K to reload the portal in a new browser tab.

The following information is for technical support purposes only:

Lab Instance: 12345678
-

You need to create a retention policy that meets the following requirements:

• Applies to Microsoft Teams chat and Teams channel messages of users that have a department attribute of Sales.
• Retains item for five years from the date they are created, and then deletes them.

To complete this task, sign in to the appropriate admin center.

SIMULATION
-

Use the following login credentials as needed:

To enter your username, place your cursor in the Sign in box and click on the username below.

To enter your password, place your cursor in the Enter password box and click on the password below.

Microsoft 365 Username: admin@123456789.onmicrosoft.com
Microsoft 365 Password: **********

If the Microsoft 365 portal does not load successfully in the browser, press CTRL-K to reload the portal in a new browser tab.

The following information is for technical support purposes only:

Lab Instance: 12345678
-

You need to retain Microsoft SharePoint files that contain the word Falcon for two years from the date they were created, and then delete them.

To complete this task, sign in to the appropriate admin center.
